awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Stability and Bifurcation in         Two-Layer Flows
awd_abstract_narration: 8902166                                                                         Renardy                                                                              This proposal will study the stability and bifurcation in                  two-layer flows involving two immiscible fluids.  Such flows                    have many applications in industry, such as the formation of                    bicomponent fibers, the transport of oil in pipelines, ink-jet                  printing and lubrication.  It is well known that such flows can                 also exhibit phenomena which are totally unexpected based on                    our knowledge of one-fluid flows.  Theoretically, many                          possibilities exist for the shape of the boundary separating                    the two fluids.  Yet experiments show that some shapes are                      preferred over others, although the underlying selection                        mechanisms are not well understood.  A chief objective of this                  proposal is to study, analytically and computationally, the                     stability of the various steady arrangements of two-layer                       flows, and the evolution of new arrangements from unstable ones.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
